ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Additional comments submitted to instructors directly. For future students considering this course, I would say that this course was well executed, had a reasonable and balanced workload, and was quite enjoyable. It adds another opportunity to the current GIS and remote sensing courses available at the University. It compliments the other offerings by extending conceptual material while addressing new technologies and processing strategies.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The best aspects of this course were the theory and also the practice. Even though the course was not about operating drones, it was very interesting on how to process data generated by the drones and how to generate insights for different applications.
Have a lot of guest speakers and learning about the newest developments in drone.
The best aspect of this course was having the time to spend analyzing data of the student's choosing, helping make the course more relevant to ongoing research projects.

-Gaining a breadth of understanding on how drones are used in various fields related to conservation / environment / consulting -Guest lectures from current experts in the drone field -Having access to current, relevant software for 3D image processing

This course combines with the practical applications of drones by inviting guest speakers from different fields. It also provides students chance to experience flying drones, which is a totally new experience for me.
Interactive and catered to students' particular interests.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: can't think of any.

The aspect of this course that needs the most improvement is spending slightly more time bringing all students up to some common knowledge base. As this is the first time the course was run, it went remarkably well considering the diverse student backgrounds.

-More hands-on, student use of drones -More interaction with professionals -- opportunities to process images for a company/project -Useful deliverables for a client / project -More use of on-campus/off-campus network to 3D images & practice in use/processing of these images -Continue to bring in experts that keep students in loop on current legality & business of drones

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Yes, the labs served a lot to understand on how to use and analyze imagery software such as a Envi and Photoscan.

The relationship between readings and speaker presentations was generally good for the first half of the term, but could have been adjusted slightly during the latter half of the term. As our collective understanding of the technology grew, it would have been nice to here more technical talks from the weekly speakers.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I study the Master of Advanced Management program from the School of Management and this topic fits very great in my learning priorities because I want to understand how different technologies can help foster new business opportunities in different areas. Also how technology can help increase economic development is an area that is very related to drone technology applications.

This course is one of many geographic/spatial courses I have taken. Through masters and phd programs my work has focused largely on spatial ecology, and I have enjoyed exploring all of the University's offerings that fit into this general geographic framework.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: My intention is to understand how drone technology work and what are their applications, specifically I was interested in Precision Agriculture applications.
Try to find an internship in the drone sector. Learn about this new technology.

I had a dataset I was interested in analyzing, but for which I had little experience. Data from unmanned aerial vehicles is unique and requires tools and techniques beyond those used in remote sensing and GIS.
Drone is definitely a bright future for many industries and academic research methods. Thus I want to learn more about trendy technology and combine them into my academic research.
To gain basic understanding of drones.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: The knowledge and skills gained from the course are very valuable for the expectations I had for this course.
Yes. I am well prepared to work with drones and drone imagery in the future.
Yes, but as the syllabus clearly states, it's best to have some remote sensing/GIS background in order to gain more from the class

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: It helps understand my group ideas and initiatives on how to solve a problem.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: If you are interested in area of opportunity that will behave dynamically in a more broad context in a few years, this course will help you know the foundations on how drone technology can bring solutions to any type of economic field.

For a student considering taking this course I would say that he/she should have a strong spatial analytical background and a clear sense of how the course fits into their program structure. For those interested in the spatial sciences, this course is an important addition to help round out technical and conceptual foundations.

-Do it. The course was interesting, insightful and relevant. -F&ES needs more courses like this. We are falling behind in the tech sector of conservation/environmentalism. Duke and UCSB are way ahead of F&ES.
